intro: Corchorus somalicus, commonly known as the Somali jute, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and alternate, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fibrous蒴果 (capsule) contains numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Corchorus somalicus is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
